    • Method Detail

      • withReasonerFactory

        public OntologicalCPNet.Builder withReasonerFactory(org.semanticweb.owlapi.reasoner.OWLReasonerFactory factory)
        Sets the specified factory object for creating OWLReasoner instances.

        The factory object is an optional parameter for the OntologicalCPNet to build. If this method is not invoked before build(), a default value will be used.

        Parameters:
        factory -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a factory object was already set for this builder

      • addPreferenceDefinition

        public OntologicalCPNet.Builder addPreferenceDefinition(java.lang.String domainValue,
                                                        org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClassExpression definition)
        OWL class definitions are required parameters for the OntologicalCPNet to build. This method must be invoked for each element returned by getPreferenceGraph().domainValues(), otherwise build() will throw an IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        domainValue -
        definition -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the specified domainValue is absent in the base CP-net or already defined set this builder

      • build

        public OntologicalCPNet build()
                       throws org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyCreationException
        Builds an OntologicalCPNet using the parameters set by this OntologicalCPNet.Builder. The preference definitions, provided to this Builder with invocations of addPreferenceDefinition(String, OWLClassExpression), are converted into OWL class definition axioms. More specifically, for each call to 
         addPreferenceDefinition(domainValue, definition)
        an OWL class C is created using domainValue as IRI suffix; then, the OWL axiom 
         EquivalentClasses(C, definition)
        is created.

        Additionally, for each preference variable A in the base CP-net with domain values a1, a2, a3, ... the OWL axiom 

         DisjointUnion(owl:Thing, a1, a2, a3, ...)
        is created, in order to "close down the world" with respect to preferences.

        The constrained ontology is created by copying the base ontology into a local OWLOntologyManager and adding the new axioms.

        This method fails if the invoking Builder is in an inconsistent state. For detailed information on setting the required parameters, see the javadoc of the remaining OntologicalCPNet.Builder methods.

        Returns:
        Throws:
        org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyCreationException - if the base ontology cannot be copied into a local OWLOntologyManager to create the constrained ontology.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the required parameters are not set properly
